section.title: Overview
section.p: This use case demonstrates the ability of NCC to provide policy rules related to user location, for example Bob restricts the access to list of Cells (Fixed Wireless example).

note.p: In this example, the policy is created to block access for cell type other than ECGI (LTE).

ul.li: Simulate attachment for a device with 3GPP-User-Location-Info is ECGI (82) to verify that NCC returns SUCCESS.
Simulate attachment for a device with 3GPP-User-Location-Info is not ECGI (82) to verify that NCC returns FAILURE (code 5003).

note.p: Ensure that after creating a record, you distribute it to ME. Otherwise, the provisioning will not be successful.

ol.li: Log in to the SM GUI and navigate to Subscriber Manager and select Devices tab. Click to create a device.
Create a rule group with Trigger = IPCAN_SESSION_ESTABLISHMENT, that rejects session establishment if the type of the 3GPP-User-Location-Info is not ECGI (82).
